inputs.name: radius
inputs.description: The radius of a hole to be filled

inputs.name: majorityThreshold
inputs.description: The number of pixels over 50% that will decide whether an OFF pixel will become ON or not. For example, if the neighborhood of a pixel has 124 pixels (excluding itself), the 50% will be 62, and if you set a Majority threshold of 5, that means that the filter will require 67 or more neighbor pixels to be ON in order to switch the current OFF pixel to ON.

inputs.name: background
inputs.description: The value associated with the background (not object)

inputs.name: foreground
inputs.description: The value associated with the foreground (object)

description: Applies a voting operation in order to fill-in cavities. This can be used for smoothing contours and for filling holes in binary images. This technique is used frequently when segmenting complete organs that may have ducts or vasculature that may not have been included in the initial segmentation, e.g. lungs, kidneys, liver.
name: Voting Binary Hole Filling Image Filter
label: Voting Binary Hole Filling Image Filter
